value.0: << ACTOR 3 >>
<< ACTOR 2 >>
<< ACTOR 1 >>
<< CUTSCENE ACTOR LIST >>
<StartAction>[As Harkon storms angrily from the chamber, your father lets out a long sigh.]</Start> I have to say I am not too terribly sorry to see him go... I never much cared for that fellow...

I can certainly understand your sentiment, Okaris, for Harkon has never been the most subtle of personalities... But he is still a High Sorcerer of Rakha, and it is foolish to anger them too greatly...
And you do not seem quite yourself, either. I have to say I am a bit concerned over your reluctance to hand over this gem to Harkon myself...
<StartAction>[The aged man turns his eyes worriedly upon your father.]</Start> Is there something you aren't telling me, my old friend?
<StartAction>[Your father smiles weakly.]</Start> I should have known better than to try and mislead you, Vhorkas... You know my mind only too well...
If you want to know the truth, I have begun to consider ridding Ghaarak of that foul gem's presence once and for all... and I have made arrangements which will allow me to do just that...
That may be very unwise, Okaris. Despite your personal feelings regarding this gem, if it is as corrupting as you claim, it may be quite dangerous if it were to fall in the wrong hands...

<StartAction>[Your father's eyes grow angry with a surprising quickness.]</Start> Do you think I have not thought of that, Vhorkas?! Of course I have! But... but I feel it would be more dangerous to keep it...
Please, Vhorkas. In all the long years we have been friends, have you known me to make a decision rashly? You must trust me on this... It... it is for the best...

<StartAction>[The man known as Vhorkas nods reluctantly.]</Start> Very well, my old friend. I can see that no words of mine will change your mind... so I shall leave it in your hands. Just... just be cautious, Okaris...

<StartAction>[Vhorkas pauses for a long moment, seemingly lost in thought, before resuming.]</Start> Is everything else alright, Okaris? You seem pale, distraught... very uncharacteristic of you... Tell me, my friend. What troubles you so?

<StartAction>[Okaris sighs, his shoulders slumping once more.]</Start> It is my <CUSTOM6001>, Vhorkas. I... I worry that I have somehow placed <him/her> in danger... and I don't know what to do about it...
You trouble yourself too greatly over <FirstName>, Okaris. I am sure a fine young <man/woman> such as <he/she> can take care of <him/her>self.

I... I am not so sure. I received a report that <FirstName> was attacked by assassins... right here in Ghaarak. It seems someone plans to make a move on me, and <FirstName> may be in grave danger because of it...
You have always had enemies, Okaris, as do all who carry the burden of the Empire's purpose in the Northern Reaches. You cannot blame yourself...
But if you are truly concerned over your <CUSTOM6001>'s safety, you could send <him/her> to join us in Zhantara... You know I would be more than willing to accept <him/her> into our ranks...

<StartAction>[Your father places his hand under his chin, pondering Vhorkas' words.]</Start> Perhaps you are right... Perhaps the time has come for <FirstName> to leave this city and find <his/her> own destiny...

It's just... it's just that I am loathe to let <him/her> go... <He/She> is all I have left of my wife, the only thing remaining which we shared together... and the only family I still have among me...

<StartAction>[That worried look passes over your father's face once more.]</Start> Vhorkas, if... if something happens to me, I want you to promise me you'll take <FirstName> with you... keep <him/her> safe...

<StartAction>[Vhorkas nods, his eyes narrowing in concern.]</Start> Of course, Okaris. You know that I would... But you worry too much. I'm sure you're going to be just fine, unless there still remains something you aren't telling me...
<StartAction>[Your father appears uncomfortable at Vhorkas' words, and his eyes roam uneasily around the chamber. He catches sight of you for the first time, and gives you a weak grin.]</Start>
Well, now... look at this. My <CUSTOM6001> has arrived, safe and out of harm's reach... a good sign indeed.

I wish we could speak more at the moment, Vhorkas, but I would like to have some time alone with <FirstName>. Perhaps we can speak further on this matter at a later time, but for now, I would like some time to myself...
<StartAction>[Vhorkas pauses, looking at Okaris for a long moment as though searching for some sort of clue to the Magistrate's elusive answers. Finally, he nods his head and bows.]</Start>

As you wish, Okaris. Speak with your <CUSTOM6001>, and we shall save these matters for another day... Now, I have other affairs which I must attend to here in the city, so I bid you farewell for the moment...

<StartAction>[Your father and the man known as Vhorkas clasp hands, nodding silently to one another in the fashion of old friends.]</Start> Farewell, Vhorkas. May Rakha keep you safe from harm, and guide your path...
The same to you, my old friend... the same to you. <StartAction>[With that, Vhorkas departs from the chamber, leaving you alone with your father.]</Start>

<StartAction>[Your father does not notice your entrance, as he seems quite preoccupied in conversation with the <Race> man standing before him.]</Start> So, Harkon, tell me... Have you and your sorcerers determined the nature of this gem?
<StartAction>[You notice the man speaking with your father. He's the same fellow you saw in the Market District earlier today, during the strange appearance of that mysterious prophet...]</Start>
It appears to be some sort of artifact from the lost age of Ghaaris, Magistrate Okaris... I have never seen such a wondrous piece of magical craftsmanship in all my days of service to Sharakha...

<StartAction>[The other man in the chamber, an aged man who carries himself with the poise of one who has seen many years of battle, begins to speak.]</Start> Okaris, you must tell us where you managed to find this marvel...

<StartAction>[A troubled expression appears on your father's face, quite uncharacteristic of his usual confident demeanor.]</Start> It was brought to the city just last week, by a group of my men campaigning in the north against rebel forces...

The reports state that my troops came upon a strange excavation site, flying the colors of the Crimson Prophet... Under orders to engage all enemy forces they encountered, my men naturally stopped to investigate.
They found the site in disarray, however. It seems some treachery was at work among the miners of the site, and many bodies lay strewn about, apparently slain by their fellow workers...

Those who yet lived were said to have gone quite mad, speaking little more than scattered gibberish. My men were able to easily secure the site, and set about determining the cause behind this strange occurrence.

Within the heart of the excavation site, my men found a mine shaft, leading far below the depths of the nearby hills to a decrepit old ruin. They claim it was filled with all manner of strange devices unseen in this day and age.
The gem was found among the scattered debris of the ruins, shining with an unnatural light. No one knew quite what to make of it, and I was contacted to determine what should be done with their find.
Knowing that Emperor Rakha has always taken a keen interest in relics from the ancient days, I ordered my men to return the gem here, and so it came to be in my possession...

<StartAction>[You notice your father's face grow more concerned.]</Start> I have since come to regret bringing it here, however... for this gem seems to be having a rather strange effect on all who come into contact with it.

<StartAction>[The man named Harkon nods his head knowingly.]</Start> These artifacts from the Golden Age often have strange effects on those who encounter them, for their potent magic is unlike any seen in this age...

<StartAction>[Your father shakes his head.]</Start> No... no, this is different. I have seen it for myself. The gem seems to put... thoughts... in the heads of those who are near its presence... dark, terrible visions...

Not long after returning the gem to the city, the patrol which found it was sent back out on duty... They... they complained of dark dreams haunting their sleep, and strange behavior among their fellow men.

Within a matter of days, we lost all contact with the patrol, and have seen no sign of them since. At the time, I put the incident down to coincidence, but I've since begun to doubt that assumption...
One of our sorcerers, Khiva, was asked to research the gem in an attempt to discern its power. He had scarcely begun work on it when he was struck with a strange madness...

I was forced to cast Khiva into our dungeons, for he did not seem himself anymore. After that, I ordered the gem be locked away in the Imperial Treasury, and contacted you to aid me with this matter...
<StartAction>[The aged man pats Okaris on the shoulder fondly.]</Start> And a good decision that was, my old friend. Don't worry, we shall get to the bottom of this matter.
<StartAction>[Your father nods, but he still seems uncomfortable.]</Start> I imagine if anyone is equipped to handle this situation, it would be you and your men, Vhorkas...
But I would ask that you be careful in your handling of this relic, for it seems to have a rather disturbing effect on all who come in contact with it. Just... just be on your guard...

<StartAction>[Harkon seems to have grown bored with your father's warnings.]</Start> Well, Okaris, if you would simply turn the gem over to me, I could take it back to Zhantara, and properly inspect it...

<StartAction>[Your father seems to consider the <Race> man's offer, but shakes his head slowly.]</Start> No, Harkon, I would not feel comfortable sending this gem to Zhantara... at least not until we know its true purpose...
<StartAction>[Harkon seems a bit angry at Okaris' refusal.]</Start> I am a High Sorcerer of Rakha, Okaris, and my own counsel. I will take on what we are equipped to handle!
<StartAction>[Your father's eyes harden.]</Start> And I am still the ruler of this city, Harkon... and you will do well to remember that. I say we keep the gem here until we know more about it...

<StartAction>[Harkon shakes his hands at the Magistrate.]</Start> You are being a fool, Okaris! Do you know that the Crimson Prophet has been sighted here in Ghaarak recently? I know, for I was there to witness it!
Yes, I had heard of the sighting... but rest assured. I have made... arrangements... which will keep the city well protected against any danger the Prophet may pose to us.
You trust too much in the defenses of Ghaarak, Okaris... Now, quit being so stubborn, and allow me to take that gem! Rakha will assuredly be interested in learning its true nature...
<StartAction>[Your father turns a steely gaze towards Harkon.]</Start> I have made my decision on this matter, Harkon, and you may either respect it, or you may leave... The choice is yours...
<StartAction>[The other man motions for his companions to ease their argument.]</Start> Please, let us not allow this situation to escalate any further. We are all friends here, remember?
Harkon, why don't you allow Okaris and I a bit of privacy? I would like to speak with the Magistrate alone...

<StartAction>[Harkon looks back and forth between the other two men, seemingly quite unhappy with the turn of events.]</Start> As you wish, Vhorkas... I believe I have seen enough here today as it is!
<StartAction>[Apparently still in quite a flurry over your father's decision, Harkon turns without another word and exits the chamber...]</Start>
